newsitem.title: UK: North Sea oil output up but Norway falls - Woodmac.
newsitem.headline: North Sea oil output up but Norway falls - Woodmac.

text.p: Offshore northwest European oil production, excluding the U.K., in October fell by 50,000 barrels per day (bpd) from September to 3.41 million bpd, consultants Wood Mackenzie said on Tuesday.
But total oil output from the North Sea rose 74,000 bpd to 5.94 million bpd due to a 125,000 bpd rise in output from the U.K. sector.

Norwegian output fell 57,000 bpd as a doubling of output from the Heidrun field was more than offset by losses due to maintenance at other fields. Gullfaks lost 204,000 bpd and Tordis 46,000 bpd due to maintenance.
Danish output rose three percent to 227,062 bpd in October, setting a new record for the fourth consecutive month.
Dutch output fell four percent to 35,000 bpd.
